Name: Arrows
Description: A fin-stabilized projectile launched by a bow.

Name: Blinding Arrows
Description: Arrows with a small clay head with an opening inside, containing a reactive chemical. On hit, the chemical releases a bright flash, blinding the target until the start of your next turn.

Name: Broadhead Arrows
Description: These arrows do 1 die less damage (e.g. 1d6 instead of 1d8), but on a critical hit these arrows apply a bleeding effect.

Name: Corkscrew Arrows
Description: More effectively travels through water. As long as the arrow was fired from outside the water, ignores the ranged weapon attack underwater combat rules.

Name: Crossbow bolts
Description: A bolt or quarrel is a dart-like projectile used by crossbows.

Name: Divine Smite
Description: On successful hit, expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to a target. Damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an undead or a fiend.

Name: Fire Arrows
Description: Open 'cage' with flammable material included. Must be ignited before fired to take effect. Ignites non-worn, non-carried flammable materials.

Name: Non-lethal Arrows
Description: These blunted arrows do 1 die less damage (e.g. 1d6 instead of 1d8), but on a critical hit these arrows apply the stunned effect to the target until the start of your next turn.

Name: Rope Arrows
Description: A 25ft rope is attached to the end of this strengthened arrow.

Name: Shuriken
Description: Small, hand-held circular plates of metal with a bladed edge.

Name: Silvered Arrows
Description: Some enemies will resist mundane weapon damage unless the weapon has been silvered.

Name: Sling bullets
Description: A blunt projectile such as a stone, clay, or lead.

Name: Smoking Arrows
Description: Arrows with a small clay head with an opening inside, containing a reactive chemical. On hit, the chemical releases smoke in a 10ft sphere, heavily obscuring vision in that area. The smoke lasts for 10 rounds, unless removed by a strong wind.

Name: Sneak Attack
Description: Apply bonus damage to an attack, when the attacker has advantage.
